members.short_doc: Filter through an array and remove empty item as defined in Ext.isEmpty. ...
members.name: clean
members.doc:
Filter through an array and remove empty item as defined in Ext.isEmpty.

See filter

members.short_doc: Clone a flat array without referencing the previous one. ...
members.name: clone
members.doc: Clone a flat array without referencing the previous one. Note that this is different from Ext.clone since it doesn't handle recursive cloning. It's simply a convenient, easy-to-remember method for Array.prototype.slice.call(array).

members.short_doc: Checks whether or not the given array contains the specified item. ...

return.doc: true if the array contains the item, false otherwise.
return.name: return

members.name: contains
members.doc: Checks whether or not the given array contains the specified item.

members.short_doc: Perform a set difference A-B by subtracting all items in array B from array A. ...
members.name: difference
members.doc: Perform a set difference A-B by subtracting all items in array B from array A.

members.short_doc: Iterates an array or an iterable value and invoke the given callback function for each item. ...

params.doc: The value to be iterated. If this argument is not iterable, the callback function is called once.
params.name: iterable

properties.doc: The item at the current index in the passed array
properties.name: item

properties.doc: The array itself which was passed as the first argument
properties.name: allItems

params.doc: The callback function. If it returns false, the iteration stops and this method returns the current index.
params.name: fn

params.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the specified function is executed.
params.name: scope

params.doc: Reverse the iteration order (loop from the end to the beginning).
params.name: reverse

members.name: each
members.doc:
Iterates an array or an iterable value and invoke the given callback function for each item.

var countries = ['Vietnam', 'Singapore', 'United States', 'Russia'];

Ext.Array.each(countries, function(name, index, countriesItSelf) {
    console.log(name);
});

var sum = function() {
    var sum = 0;

    Ext.Array.each(arguments, function(value) {
        sum += value;
    });

    return sum;
};

sum(1, 2, 3); // returns 6

The iteration can be stopped by returning false in the function callback.

Ext.Array.each(countries, function(name, index, countriesItSelf) {
    if (name === 'Singapore') {
        return false; // break here
    }
});

Ext.each is alias for Ext.Array.each

members.short_doc: Removes items from an array. ...

params.doc: The index in the array at which to operate.
params.name: index

params.doc: The number of items to remove at index.
params.name: removeCount

members.name: erase
members.doc: Removes items from an array. This is functionally equivalent to the splice method of Array, but works around bugs in IE8's splice method and does not copy the removed elements in order to return them (because very often they are ignored).

members.short_doc: Executes the specified function for each array element until the function returns a falsy value. ...

return.doc: true if no false value is returned by the callback function.
return.name: return

members.name: every
members.doc: Executes the specified function for each array element until the function returns a falsy value. If such an item is found, the function will return false immediately. Otherwise, it will return true.

members.short_doc:
Creates a new array with all of the elements of this array for which
the provided filtering function returns true. ...
members.name: filter
members.doc: Creates a new array with all of the elements of this array for which the provided filtering function returns true.

members.short_doc: Recursively flattens into 1-d Array. ...
members.name: flatten
members.doc: Recursively flattens into 1-d Array. Injects Arrays inline.

members.short_doc: Iterates an array and invoke the given callback function for each item. ...

properties.doc: The item at the current index in the passed array.
properties.name: item

properties.doc: The array itself which was passed as the first argument.
properties.name: allItems

params.doc: The execution scope (this) in which the specified function is executed.
params.name: scope

members.name: forEach
members.doc: Iterates an array and invoke the given callback function for each item. Note that this will simply delegate to the native Array.prototype.forEach method if supported. It doesn't support stopping the iteration by returning false in the callback function like each. However, performance could be much better in modern browsers comparing with each

members.short_doc:
Converts a value to an array if it's not already an array; returns:


An empty array if given value is undefined or n...

params.doc: The value to convert to an array if it's not already is an array.
params.name: value

params.doc: true to clone the given array and return a new reference if necessary.
params.name: newReference

members.name: from
members.doc:
Converts a value to an array if it's not already an array; returns:

  • An empty array if given value is undefined or null
  • Itself if given value is already an array
  • An array copy if given value is iterable (arguments, NodeList and alike)
  • An array with one item which is the given value, otherwise

members.short_doc: Push an item into the array only if the array doesn't contain it yet. ...
members.name: include
members.doc: Push an item into the array only if the array doesn't contain it yet.

members.short_doc:
Get the index of the provided item in the given array, a supplement for the
missing arrayPrototype.indexOf in Interne...

params.doc: The index at which to begin the search.
params.name: from

return.doc: The index of item in the array (or -1 if it is not found).
return.name: return

members.name: indexOf
members.doc: Get the index of the provided item in the given array, a supplement for the missing arrayPrototype.indexOf in Internet Explorer.

members.short_doc: Inserts items in to an array. ...

params.doc: The index in the array at which to operate.
params.name: index

params.doc: The array of items to insert at index.
params.name: items

members.name: insert
members.doc: Inserts items in to an array.

members.short_doc: Merge multiple arrays into one with unique items that exist in all of the arrays. ...
members.name: intersect
members.doc: Merge multiple arrays into one with unique items that exist in all of the arrays.

members.short_doc: Creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in this array. ...
members.name: map
members.doc: Creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in this array.

members.short_doc: Returns the maximum value in the Array. ...

params.doc: The Array from which to select the maximum value.
params.name: array

params.doc: a function to perform the comparison which determines maximization. If omitted the ">" operator will be used. Note: gt = 1; eq = 0; lt = -1
params.name: comparisonFn

members.name: max
members.doc: Returns the maximum value in the Array.

members.short_doc: Calculates the mean of all items in the array. ...

params.doc: The Array to calculate the mean value of.
params.name: array

members.name: mean
members.doc: Calculates the mean of all items in the array.

members.short_doc: Merge multiple arrays into one with unique items. ...
members.name: merge
members.doc:
Merge multiple arrays into one with unique items.

union is alias for merge

members.short_doc: Returns the minimum value in the Array. ...

params.doc: The Array from which to select the minimum value.
params.name: array

params.doc: a function to perform the comparison which determines minimization. If omitted the "<" operator will be used. Note: gt = 1; eq = 0; lt = -1
params.name: comparisonFn

members.name: min
members.doc: Returns the minimum value in the Array.

members.short_doc: Plucks the value of a property from each item in the Array. ...

params.doc: The Array of items to pluck the value from.
params.name: array

params.doc: The property name to pluck from each element.
params.name: propertyName

return.doc: The value from each item in the Array.
return.name: return

members.name: pluck
members.doc:
Plucks the value of a property from each item in the Array. Example:

Ext.Array.pluck(Ext.query("p"), "className"); // [el1.className, el2.className, ..., elN.className]

members.short_doc: Removes the specified item from the array if it exists. ...
members.name: remove
members.doc: Removes the specified item from the array if it exists.

members.short_doc: Replaces items in an array. ...

params.doc: The index in the array at which to operate.
params.name: index

params.doc: The number of items to remove at index (can be 0).
params.name: removeCount

params.doc: An array of items to insert at index.
params.name: insert

members.name: replace
members.doc: Replaces items in an array. This is functionally equivalent to the splice method of Array, but works around bugs in IE8's splice method and is often more convenient to call because it accepts an array of items to insert rather than use a variadic argument list.

members.short_doc: Returns a shallow copy of a part of an array. ...

params.doc: The index at which to begin. Negative values are offsets from the end of the array.
params.name: begin

params.doc: The index at which to end. The copied items do not include end. Negative values are offsets from the end of the array. If end is omitted, all items up to the end of the array are copied.
params.name: end

members.name: slice
members.doc: Returns a shallow copy of a part of an array. This is equivalent to the native call Array.prototype.slice.call(array, begin, end). This is often used when "array" is "arguments" since the arguments object does not supply a slice method but can be the context object to Array.prototype.slice().

members.short_doc: Executes the specified function for each array element until the function returns a truthy value. ...

return.doc: true if the callback function returns a truthy value.
return.name: return

members.name: some
members.doc: Executes the specified function for each array element until the function returns a truthy value. If such an item is found, the function will return true immediately. Otherwise, it will return false.

members.short_doc: Sorts the elements of an Array. ...
members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorts the elements of an Array. By default, this method sorts the elements alphabetically and ascending.

members.short_doc: Replaces items in an array. ...

params.doc: The index in the array at which to operate.
params.name: index

params.doc: The number of items to remove at index (can be 0).
params.name: removeCount

members.name: splice
members.doc: Replaces items in an array. This is equivalent to the splice method of Array, but works around bugs in IE8's splice method. The signature is exactly the same as the splice method except that the array is the first argument. All arguments following removeCount are inserted in the array at index.

members.short_doc: Calculates the sum of all items in the given array. ...

params.doc: The Array to calculate the sum value of.
params.name: array

members.name: sum
members.doc: Calculates the sum of all items in the given array.

members.short_doc: Converts any iterable (numeric indices and a length property) into a true array. ...

params.doc: the iterable object to be turned into a true Array.
params.name: iterable

params.doc: a zero-based index that specifies the start of extraction.
params.name: start

params.doc: a zero-based index that specifies the end of extraction.
params.name: end

members.name: toArray
members.doc:
Converts any iterable (numeric indices and a length property) into a true array.

function test() {
    var args = Ext.Array.toArray(arguments),
        fromSecondToLastArgs = Ext.Array.toArray(arguments, 1);

    alert(args.join(' '));
    alert(fromSecondToLastArgs.join(' '));
}

test('just', 'testing', 'here'); // alerts 'just testing here';
                                 // alerts 'testing here';

Ext.Array.toArray(document.getElementsByTagName('div')); // will convert the NodeList into an array
Ext.Array.toArray('splitted'); // returns ['s', 'p', 'l', 'i', 't', 't', 'e', 'd']
Ext.Array.toArray('splitted', 0, 3); // returns ['s', 'p', 'l', 'i']

Ext.toArray is alias for Ext.Array.toArray

members.short_doc: Merge multiple arrays into one with unique items. ...
members.name: union
members.doc:
Merge multiple arrays into one with unique items.

union is alias for merge

members.short_doc: Returns a new array with unique items. ...
members.name: unique
members.doc: Returns a new array with unique items.

doc: A set of useful static methods to deal with arrays; provide missing methods for older browsers.
name: Ext.Array
